item.title: (need a better ipban)
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

Look where it handles where people login, check the IP against the banned IP (I’d suggest using a file for banned IPs) and if it’s banned, close the connectors socket.

Read full topic

item.title: (need a better ipban)
item.dc:creator: @mata20000 mata20000
item.description:
@mata20000 wrote:

that is what i currently have.

the problem is that after i ipban someone they can still make a new account and mess up server but after they log out and in they are banned.

I need a code that if a banned ip is detected to imidietly kick the user after they log in

if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 3))
{
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];
appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
v.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(“player successfully ip banned”);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {

appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
v.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(“Error logging ip bans!”);
}
}
